mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A Synopsis of the Rattans (Arecaceae: Calamoideae) of Laos and Neighbouring Parts of Indochina

nomenclature.name: Calamus dongnaiensis
nomenclature.author: Pierre ex Becc.
nomenclature.bibref: Gagnep. & Conrard in Gagnep. (ed.), Fl. Indo-Chine 6: 1009 (1937)
Evans et al., Rattans Lao PDR: 23 (2001)
nomenclature.type_loc: Holotype P; isotype FI-B, photograph in K

div.p: Indochinese endemic, known only from the type locality.
VIETNAM (COCHINCHINA): north region of Dongnai R., Chiao-Xhan, undated, (pist.), Pierre 4829 (P, K [photo], FI-B).

Gagnepain & Conrard (1937) cited a second locality, "Long Tcheou" in Tonkin, which is now believed to lie in Guangxi, China. It was not possible to re- examine this specimen during the study but its identification should be carefully re- assessed since several other erect species have been described from South-east China since 1937 (Wei 1986). Vu Van Dung & Le Huy Guang (1996) report the species at two new localities in South Annam but cite no specimens to support this.
Unknown, but likely to be poor. Habitat loss has probably been severe in this heavily populated part of Vietnam.
